problem: What is the sum of the squares of all real values of $x$ for which $|2-|x| |=1$?
solution:
The absolute value of a number equals 1 if and only if the number equals either $-1$ or 1.  Setting $2-|x|$ equal to 1 and to $-1$, we solve \begin{align*}
2-|x|=1 \quad &\text{or} \quad 2-|x|=-1 \\
|x|=1 \quad &\text{or} \quad |x|=3 \\
x=\pm1 \quad &\text{or} \quad x=\pm3.
\end{align*} The sum of the squares of these four solutions is $(-1)^2+1^2+(-3)^2+3^2=\boxed{20}$.
